summary: This is an email chain from July 10-11, 2019, discussing inter-agency coordination and potential jurisdictional conflicts in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. It reveals that the FBI directed NYPD's Special Victims Unit to 'stand down' and route all Epstein matters through federal authorities, while noting that the District Attorney's Office for New York County (DANY) was proceeding with its own investigation and had contacted a victim.

persons.name: Berman, Geoffrey
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: The sender of the final email in the chain, proposing a compromise interview protocol involving a Child Forensic Interviewer (CFI).

persons.name: Sweeney
persons.role: Unspecified official (likely law enforcement or legal)
persons.context: Spoken to by Geoffrey Berman regarding a compromise interview protocol for the investigation.

connections.description: Berman states he spoke to Sweeney to arrange a compromise interview protocol for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI directs NYPD SVU to stand down
events.description: The FBI reached out to NYPD leadership and directed that the Special Victims Unit (SVU) stand down, requiring all Epstein-related matters to go through federal authorities.

events.title: Scheduled victim interviews
events.description: Interviews with victims were lined up for Friday, July 12, 2019, involving agents who were in Florida conducting approaches.

events.title: DANY contacts victim via NBC News
events.description: The District Attorney's Office for New York County (DANY) proceeded with its own investigation and had already reached out to a victim through NBC News to arrange an interview.

keyFacts: The FBI instructed NYPD leadership that its Special Victims Unit (SVU) was to 'stand down' and that all Epstein-related matters must be routed through federal authorities.

The District Attorney's Office for New York County (DANY) was continuing its own parallel investigation and had contacted a victim through NBC News to arrange an interview, raising concerns about double jeopardy and statute of limitations (SOL) issues.
Federal agents were actively in Florida conducting victim approaches and interviews, with more scheduled for July 12, 2019.

A compromise interview protocol was established involving a Child Forensic Interviewer (CFI) in the room, with interviews conducted by an AUSA and an agent, following a pre-interview strategy session.
